channel.title: Major Revisions
channel.description: A podcast from three early career ecologists about science, academia, life, and other stuff.
channel.itunes:author: J. W. Atkins, J. Walter, G. Wilkinson
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast from three early career ecologists…
channel.itunes:keywords: science, ecology, biology, podcast, academia, academe, higher education, science communication, environmental sciences, environment

item.title: MR039 The Culture of Ecology
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about recent op-eds in Nature and Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment on the culture of science and ecology in particular. How do we build strong lab culture? How do we think about and do science in the 21st Century? Is the underlying culture of science at risk? Also, Jeff's car was eaten by rats and we talk MDPI journals and how you can publish multiple OA articles for free, if they are well-prepared.
item.itunes:subtitle: Is the culture of ecology at risk?...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about recent op-eds in Nature and Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment on the culture of science and ecology in particular. How do we build strong lab culture? How do we think about and do science in the 21st Century? Is the underlying culture of science at risk? Also, Jeff's car was eaten by rats and we talk MDPI journals and how you can publish multiple OA articles for free, if they are well-prepared.

item.title: MR038 An Interview with Brady Hardiman
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: In episode 38 we welcome Brady Hardiman to the show! Brady is an Assistant Professor of Urban Ecology in the department of Forestry and Natural Resources at Purdue University (Go Boilermakers!). We talk about urban ecology, macrosystems, time management, mentorship, being a new professor, and setting up a lab and creating a positive and supportive atmosphere.
item.itunes:subtitle: Brady Hardiman...
item.description: In episode 38 we welcome Brady Hardiman to the show! Brady is an Assistant Professor of Urban Ecology in the department of Forestry and Natural Resources at Purdue University (Go Boilermakers!). We talk about urban ecology, macrosystems, time management, mentorship, being a new professor, and setting up a lab and creating a positive and supportive atmosphere.

item.title: MR037 Classic Ecology III: Gleason, 1926
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about the Gleason, 1926 classic, "The individualistic concept of the plant association" a real barn-burner of a piece that forms one of the foundational pieces of community ecology--despite its controversial reception at the time. The group also chat up the first part of the Dynamic Ecology controversial ideas in ecology piece, why Jeff is a terrible biologist, and talk trash about Kant.
item.itunes:subtitle: Classic ecology III: Gleason, 1926...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about the Gleason, 1926 classic, "The individualistic concept of the plant association" a real barn-burner of a piece that forms one of the foundational pieces of community ecology--despite its controversial reception at the time. The group also chat up the first part of the Dynamic Ecology controversial ideas in ecology piece, why Jeff is a terrible biologist, and talk trash about Kant.

item.title: MR036 Classic Ecology II: Lindeman, 1942
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff keep the classics in ecology series going, this time with Raymond L. Lindeman's 1942 piece, "The Trophic-Dynamic Aspect of Ecology." This seminal piece not only codified the idea of the ecosystem, but features the famous (infamous?) ooze diagram. The gang also lament March Mammal Madness and the ups and downs of spring time.
item.itunes:subtitle: Classic ecology II: Lindeman, 1942...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff keep the classics in ecology series going, this time with Raymond L. Lindeman's 1942 piece, "The Trophic-Dynamic Aspect of Ecology." This seminal piece not only codified the idea of the ecosystem, but features the famous (infamous?) ooze diagram. The gang also lament March Mammal Madness and the ups and downs of spring time.

item.title: MR035 Classic Ecology I: Moran, 1953
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff kick off a series delving into classic papers in ecology, leading off with P. A. P. Moran's classic paper "The statistical analysis of the Canadian Lynx Cycle II: Synchronization and Meteorology" which helped to launch the concept of spatial synchrony, fluctuations that are correlated through time across two ore more locations, a fundamental aspect of population ecology. The gang also talk about March Mammal Madness (#2018MMM) and their picks this year and how few of the actual animals they know.
item.itunes:subtitle: Classic ecology, Moran 1953...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff kick off a series delving into classic papers in ecology, leading off with P. A. P. Moran's classic paper "The statistical analysis of the Canadian Lynx Cycle II: Synchronization and Meteorology" which helped to launch the concept of spatial synchrony, fluctuations that are correlated through time across two ore more locations, a fundamental aspect of population ecology. The gang also talk about March Mammal Madness (#2018MMM) and their picks this year and how few of the actual animals they know.

item.title: MR034 An interview with Caitlin MacKenzie
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: We talk to Caitlin MacKenzie, a postdoc at the University of Maine, about taking sediment cores from frozen lakes in Maine, what it's like to put together and deliver a TEDx talk on an 19th century botanist, surviving the snowscape she calls home, and conservation, phenology, and ecology in New England.
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Caitlin MacKenzie...
item.description: We talk to Caitlin MacKenzie, a postdoc at the University of Maine, about taking sediment cores from frozen lakes in Maine, what it's like to put together and deliver a TEDx talk on an 19th century botanist, surviving the snowscape she calls home, and conservation, phenology, and ecology in New England.

item.title: MR033 Getting Into Grad School 3: The Interview!
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff jump into the murky and oddly shaped pool that is the world of the graduate school interview. We also go on a journey to find out what happened to Grace's phone, how scientists find love, and the only five hobbies graduate students are allowed to have. Jeff and Grace also bond over their love of Otterbox.
item.itunes:subtitle: The grad school interview...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff jump into the murky and oddly shaped pool that is the world of the graduate school interview. We also go on a journey to find out what happened to Grace's phone, how scientists find love, and the only five hobbies graduate students are allowed to have. Jeff and Grace also bond over their love of Otterbox.

item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about #SinceIWasYoung.

item.title: MR031 The Professor is In
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff reconvene book club to chat about the Professor is In!

item.title: MR030 How To Do Ecology?
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff are back in book club this episode, talking about the book "How to do Ecology." The gang also talk about how academics and scientists spend their holidays.
item.itunes:subtitle: How to do ecology...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff are back in book club this episode, talking about the book "How to do Ecology." The gang also talk about how academics and scientists spend their holidays.

item.title: MR029 The 100 Papers Every Ecologist Should Read?
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff jump right into the fray this week to talk about a recent, divisive article in Nature Ecology and Evolution about the papers every ecologist should be reading.
item.itunes:subtitle: 100 papers...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff jump right into the fray this week to talk about a recent, divisive article in Nature Ecology and Evolution about the papers every ecologist should be reading.

item.title: MR028 The Impact Factor Draft
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: It is time for the inaugural Impact Factor Draft! Grace, Jon, and Jeff pick journals based on how they think the IF will change next year. Really it is just an excuse to talk about the landscape of ecological journals.
item.itunes:subtitle: Inaugural Impact Factor Draft...
item.description: It is time for the inaugural Impact Factor Draft! Grace, Jon, and Jeff pick journals based on how they think the IF will change next year. Really it is just an excuse to talk about the landscape of ecological journals.

item.title: MR027 One Year Anniversary
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff revisit the first year of the podcast, including the most and least popular episodes--and we look forward to the future.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our first year, woohoo!...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff revisit the first year of the podcast, including the most and least popular episodes--and we look forward to the future.

item.title: MR026 Carbon, carbon, carbon!
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace and Jeff, sans Jon, talk about some of the latest in carbon cycling research--terrestrial and aquatic! We also talk Jon's recent wedding, examine a new paper in Science focusing on the tropics, a great piece on science blogging, and talk about the podcast's upcoming anniversary. Oh, and cow farts. Lots about cow farts.
item.itunes:subtitle: We are talking about carbon...
item.description: Grace and Jeff, sans Jon, talk about some of the latest in carbon cycling research--terrestrial and aquatic! We also talk Jon's recent wedding, examine a new paper in Science focusing on the tropics, a great piece on science blogging, and talk about the podcast's upcoming anniversary. Oh, and cow farts. Lots about cow farts.

item.title: MR025 Difficult Conversations
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff do a deep dive into having difficult conversations in the classroom around the current political and social climate and how to respond to situations in a thoughtful, and supportive manner.
item.itunes:subtitle: Difficult conversations...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff do a deep dive into having difficult conversations in the classroom around the current political and social climate and how to respond to situations in a thoughtful, and supportive manner.

item.title: MR024 Making the Most Out of Grad School
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about how to get the most out of grad school including setting priorities, making friends with the smart people, thinking about it as a career, and whether classes "really" matter.
item.itunes:subtitle: Making the most out of grad school...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about how to get the most out of grad school including setting priorities, making friends with the smart people, thinking about it as a career, and whether classes "really" matter.

item.title: MR023 Throwin' Shade
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: In our first banter-only episode, Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about the eclipse, the comings and goings of the Ecological Society of America 2017 meeting in Portland, pre-registering ecology articles and studies, and the question of censorship of science.
item.itunes:subtitle: Total Ecology of the Heart...
item.description: In our first banter-only episode, Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about the eclipse, the comings and goings of the Ecological Society of America 2017 meeting in Portland, pre-registering ecology articles and studies, and the question of censorship of science.

item.title: MR022 The Intermediate Disturbance Hypothesis
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk Intermediate Disturbance Hypothesis (IDH), the idea that diversity peaks at "intermediate" levels of disturbance. We also preview ESA 2017 and ponder the relationship between food quality and the amount of taxidermy in North Wood's bars.
item.itunes:subtitle: Intermediate Disturbance Hypothesis...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk Intermediate Disturbance Hypothesis (IDH), the idea that diversity peaks at "intermediate" levels of disturbance. We also preview ESA 2017 and ponder the relationship between food quality and the amount of taxidermy in North Wood's bars.

item.title: MR021 Work Life Balance
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff discuss their own trials and tribulations of trying to make a career in the sciences jive with a home life that approaches normality. Jeff pines about the early summer flailing nature of one member of the Red Sox pitching staff and the gang talk dog fashion shows. And science. Some science too.
item.itunes:subtitle: Balancing Work and Life?...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff discuss their own trials and tribulations of trying to make a career in the sciences jive with a home life that approaches normality. Jeff pines about the early summer flailing nature of one member of the Red Sox pitching staff and the gang talk dog fashion shows. And science. Some science too.

item.title: MR020 Lab Girl!
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff *finally* get around to talking about Hope Jahren's book "Lab Girl" and what it means to them as ecologists and early career scientists.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lab Girl...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff *finally* get around to talk about Hope Jahren's book "Lab Girl" and what it meant to them as ecologists and early career scientists.

item.title: MR019 Grants Rule Everything Around Me
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace just got back from an NSF conference on grants and gives the low-down to the gang and we talk different kinds of grants, application strategies, and also alternative funding sources. The gang also pours one out for DDIG.
item.itunes:subtitle: Grant funding...
item.description: Grace just got back from an NSF conference on grants and gives the low-down to the gang and we talk different kinds of grants, application strategies, and also alternative funding sources. The gang also pours one out for DDIG.

item.title: MR018 On the Job Market (Part 1 of n)
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about a recent blog post for Jeremy Yoder on his journey towards the tenure track. The gang also talk about the beloved and reviled ecoevo jobs board and Jon's recent 1600 mile cross-country journey as he moves from Kansas back to Virginia.
item.itunes:subtitle: On the job market...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about a recent blog post for Jeremy Yoder on his journey towards the tenure track. The gang also talk about the beloved and reviled ecoevo jobs board and Jon's recent 1600 mile cross-country journey as he moves from Kansas back to Virginia.

item.title: MR017 An Interview with Terry McGlynn
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Following up a conversation from Twitter about academic publishing, Jeff talks to special guest Terry McGlynn, Professor of Biology at Cal State Dominguez Hills, about everything from strategies in suggesting reviewers to how junior and senior scientists approach publishing differently.
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Terry McGlynn...
item.description: Following up a conversation from Twitter about academic publishing, Jeff talks to special guest Terry McGlynn, Professor of Biology at Cal State Dominguez Hills, about everything from strategies in suggesting reviewers to how junior and senior scientists approach publishing differently.

item.title: MR016 Motivation, Inspiration, and Application
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about what motivates them as scientists and discuss a Dynamic Ecology post from Jeremy Fox about basic vs. applied science. The gang also play a game of five questions.
item.itunes:subtitle: Why do you science the way you science?...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about what motivates them as scientists and discuss a Dynamic Ecology post from Jeremy Fox about basic vs. applied science. The gang also play a game of five questions.

item.title: MR014 Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About Field Work
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff relate (pretty near) everything they know about the perils and pitfalls of ecological fieldwork--from buying the good footwear to making sure your permits are filed on time. The gang catch up on their March Mammal Madness brackets and also tell stories about their worst experiences in the field.
item.itunes:subtitle: Summer is coming, are your field experiements ready?...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff relate (pretty near) everything they know about the perils and pitfalls of ecological fieldwork--from buying the good footwear to making sure your permits are filed on time. The gang catch up on their March Mammal Madness brackets and also tell stories about their worst experiences in the field.

item.title: MR013 March Mammal Madness
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about the recent ASLO and Royal Society meetings they attended and then debate the March Mammal Madness bracket and English breakfast. Teaser...Marmite is gluten-free.
item.itunes:subtitle: Let the March Mammal Madness begin!...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about the recent ASLO and Royal Society meetings they attended and then debate the March Mammal Madness bracket and English breakfast. Teaser...Marmite is gluten-free.

item.title: MR012 Understudied Areas of Ecology and Rejection!
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about what it is like to get your manuscript rejected and how to deal with it. The gang also talk about a Reiners et al. 2016 paper about the topics in ecology that ecologists value based on utility and then offer their two cents about areas they fill are underrepresented.
item.itunes:subtitle: What are the more understudied areas of ecology and what about rejection?...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about what it is like to get your manuscript rejected and how to deal with it. The gang also talk about a Reiners et al. 2016 paper about the topics in ecology that ecologists value based on utility and then offer their two cents about areas they fill are underrepresented.

item.title: MR011 Academic Productivity and the Science March
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff have their first (of probably many) conversation(s) on the Science March on Washington and how to better engage outside of the science bubble. The gang also talk about a recent article in Ecosphere, "Academic Productivity in the Field of Ecology," and what it really means. What does productivity look like? How should we compare departments, or should we? Also, how the hell do you say Oikos anyway?
item.itunes:subtitle: The Science March, Academic Productivity, and how do you say Oikos?...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff have their first (of probably many) conversation(s) on the Science March on Washington and how to better engage outside of the science bubble. The gang also talk about a recent article in Ecosphere, "Academic Productivity in the Field of Ecology," and what it really means. What does productivity look like? How should we compare departments, or should we? Also, how the hell do you say Oikos anyway?

item.title: MR010 Regime Shifts
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff discuss regime shifts, state changes, basin attractors, and football pronostication.
item.itunes:subtitle: Regime shifts...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff discuss regime shifts, state changes, basin attractors, and football pronostication.

item.title: MR009 Ecological Theory and You, a Love Story
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff examine the meaning and importance of "ecological theory" from the perspectives of different research areas and degrees of interaction with theoretical ecology. The gang also give some highlights and favorite papers from 2016.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ecological theory...
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff examine the meaning and importance of "ecological theory" from the perspectives of different research areas and degrees of interaction with theoretical ecology. The gang also give some highlights and favorite papers from 2016.

item.title: MR008 Science Policy for Beginners
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff are joined by Blair St. Ledger-Olson, a former congressional staffer, and Dr. Jessica Gephart, from SESYNC, to talk about how scientists can learn about policy, how policy decisions are made, and how scientists can inform policy/policymakers. The role of scientific societies also comes up--and we think you should join!
item.itunes:subtitle: Policy for beginners…
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff are joined by Blair St. Ledger-Olson, a former congressional staffer, and Dr. Jessica Gephart, from SESYNC, to talk about how scientists can learn about policy, how policy decisions are made, and how scientists can inform policy/policymakers. The role of scientific societies also comes up--and we think you should join!

item.title: MR007 Lasers!
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about ecological uses of LiDAR (lasers!) and banter about the best holiday foods.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ecological uses of lasers!…
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about ecological uses of LiDAR (lasers!) and banter about the best holiday foods.

item.title: MR006 (Most) Everything You Need to Know About Getting into Grad School (part two)
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff fill in some more information about the process of applying to and getting into graduate school in the sciences with a focus on letters of recommendation, cover letters, and campus visits.
item.itunes:subtitle: More applying to grad school in the sciences…
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff fill in some more information about the process of applying to and getting into graduate school in the sciences with a focus on letters of recommendation, cover letters, and campus visits.

item.title: MR005 (Most) Everything You Need to Know About Getting into Grad School (part one)
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about how to apply to graduate school in the sciences . . . what to consider, where to apply, what the process entails, and what you should really expect.
item.itunes:subtitle: Applying to grad school in the sciences…
item.description: Grace, Jon, and Jeff talk about how to apply to graduate school in the sciences . . . what to consider, where to apply, what the process entails, and what you should really expect.

item.title: MR004 The Perils of Peer Review (part two)
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jeff, and Jon wrap-up their discussion on peer review--including the major flaw they encounter when reviewing, how to address revisions to your work, and the future of peer review. The gang also battle with the question of whether undergrads should have to take calculus or if Bob Dylan will ever acknowledge his Nobel Prize.
item.itunes:subtitle: Grace, Jeff, and Jon wrap-up their discussion on …
item.description: Grace, Jeff, and Jon wrap-up their discussion on peer review--including the major flaw they encounter when reviewing, how to address revisions to your work, and the future of peer review. The gang also battle with the question of whether undergrads should have to take calculus or if Bob Dylan will ever acknowledge his Nobel Prize.

item.title: MR003 The Perils of Peer Review (part one)
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: On this episode of Major Revisions, Grace, Jeff, and Jon discuss part one of the process of academic peer review--including how and where to submit a paper, how to select reviewers, and how to respond to both positive and negative reviews. The gang also talk about weird experiences out in society, how to deal with a spouse who has a cooler study organism than you do, and disagree about dolphins.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this episode of Major Revisions, Grace, Jeff, …
item.description: On this episode of Major Revisions, Grace, Jeff, and Jon discuss part one of the process of academic peer review--including how and where to submit a paper, how to select reviewers, and how to respond to both positive and negative reviews. The gang also talk about weird experiences out in society, how to deal with a spouse who has a cooler study organism than you do, and disagree about dolphins.

item.title: MR002 100 Questions About the Future of Ecology (part 2): The Reckoning
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: Grace, Jeff and Jon revisit the conversation from last episode about the future of ecology and address possible Nobel Prizes for great ideas in ecology. The gang also discuss how Powerball works and the new Bon Iver album.
item.itunes:subtitle: Grace, Jeff and Jon revisit the conversation from…

item.title: Major Revisions - Episode One 100 Questions in Ecology (part one)
item.itunes:author: Major Revisions
item.itunes:summary: In the inaugural show, Jon, Grace, and Jeff discuss an article on the 100 questions for the future of ecology--from how to define and refine spatial scales, to addressing publication and the "final drawer" problem.
item.itunes:subtitle: In the inaugural show, Jon, Grace, and Jeff discuss…
